## Recommended Workflow

### Phase 1: Planning & Design Validation
```bash
/ui-plan "Repurpose.io Navbar: sticky navigation with logo (180px), 5 nav items (Content Creators, Small Business, E-commerce, Agency, Pricing) with 40px gap, and action buttons (Log In + Start Free Trial CTA)"

/ui-plan "Repurpose.io Hero: announcement banner (48px gradient purple), main heading (72px, 800 weight), subheading (32px blue #6B7FFF), primary CTA button (gradient pink), phone mockups grid (4 platforms)"

/ui-plan "Repurpose.io Social Proof: section heading, 2-column grid with stats card (650,000+ creators) and featured testimonial, 3-column testimonial row, integration partners grid, YouTube partnership card"
```

### Phase 2: Generate Components
```bash
/ui-new "Repurpose.io Navbar" --baseline
# Generates 3 variants based on wireframe specs

/ui-new "Repurpose.io Hero Section" --baseline
# Generates hero with all specifications from wireframes

/ui-new "Repurpose.io Social Proof Section" --baseline
# Generates testimonials, stats, and partner logos
```

### Phase 3: Review & Validate
```bash
/ui-review src/components/RepurposeNavbar.vue --fix --polish
# Checks design system compliance, accessibility, tokens

/ui-validate --tokens --a11y --all
# Validates all components against design-system.css

/ui-screenshot src/components/RepurposeNavbar.vue --baseline --all-states
# Captures screenshots for visual regression
```

### Phase 4: Refactor (if needed)
```bash
/ui-refactor "RepurposeHero" "Extract phone mockup into reusable PhoneMockup.vue component with platform prop" --compose

/ui-refactor "testimonial" "Consolidate testimonial cards into single TestimonialCard.vue with size variant" --batch
```

## Why This Workflow?

1. **`/ui-plan`** - Generates ASCII wireframes and searches existing patterns before coding
2. **`/ui-new`** - Complete creation workflow: plan â†’ generate 3 variants â†’ refine â†’ validate â†’ screenshot
3. **`/ui-review`** - Quality audit with auto-fix for tokens, accessibility, and design system compliance
4. **`/ui-validate`** - Batch validation across all components
5. **`/ui-screenshot`** - Visual regression testing with baseline management
6. **`/ui-refactor`** - Extract reusable patterns and consolidate duplicates

## Key Insights from Wireframes

The document contains **precise specifications** for:
- Typography scale (72px â†’ 14px with exact weights)
- Color palette (CSS custom properties ready)
- Spacing system (8px base unit)
- Component dimensions (exact px values)
- Responsive breakpoints (1440px â†’ 375px)
- Interactive states (hover transforms, shadows)
- Accessibility requirements (WCAG AA contrast, focus indicators)

**Start with `/ui-plan` for each section** - it will analyze the wireframe specs and generate implementation-ready component plans with variants.

# UI Component Planning

1. **Base components:** `ls src/components/vue/base/`

3. **Similar patterns:** `grep -r "similar-pattern" src/components/vue/`

### Include in Plan
- Which base components to extend (if any)
- Which animation presets to use (useAnimateElement, VueUse Motion, or Tailwind utilities)
- Whether state management needed (Nanostore + BaseStore pattern)
- Whether data validation needed (Zod schema matching Appwrite attributes)
- Icon strategy (@iconify/vue with mdi or simple-icons collections)

## Process

1. **Understand Requirements**

   - Determine component category (button, card, modal, input, etc.)

2. **Search for Existing Patterns**
   - Search `src/components/vue/` for similar components
   - Look for reusable base components
   - Identify provider pattern opportunities
   - Check for composition possibilities

3. **Analyze Design Requirements**
   - Review `src/styles/design-system.css` for available tokens
   - Identify required colors, spacing, typography
   - Determine if new tokens are needed
   - Check for visual consistency with existing components

4. **Create Implementation Plan**
   - Decide: Reuse, Compose, or Create New
   - List required design tokens
   - Outline component structure
   - Identify accessibility requirements
   - Note performance considerations

<script setup lang="ts">
import { computed, type HTMLAttributes } from "vue"
import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

interface Props {
  variant?: "default" | "outline" | "ghost" | "link"
  size?: "default" | "sm" | "lg"
  class?: HTMLAttributes["class"]
  as?: string
}

const props = withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {
  variant: "default",
  size: "default",
  as: "button"
})

const buttonClass = computed(() => {
  // Base styles using design system tokens
  const baseStyles = [
    "inline-flex items-center justify-center gap-2",
    "font-medium",
    "rounded",
    "transition-all duration-200",
    "ease-out",
    "focus-visible:outline-none",
    "focus-ring", // Custom utility from utilities.css
    "disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50",
    "active:scale-[0.98]" // Subtle press effect
  ].join(" ")

  // Variant styles using design tokens
  const variants = {
    default: [
      "bg-primary-600",
      "text-white",
      "hover:bg-primary-700",
      "dark:bg-primary-500",
      "dark:hover:bg-primary-600",
      "shadow-sm",
      "hover:shadow-md"
    ].join(" "),
    outline: [
      "border border-gray-300",
      "dark:border-gray-700",
      "bg-transparent",
      "hover:bg-gray-100",
      "dark:hover:bg-gray-800",
      "text-gray-900 dark:text-gray-100"
    ].join(" "),
    ghost: [
      "hover:bg-gray-100",
      "dark:hover:bg-gray-800",
      "text-gray-900 dark:text-gray-100"
    ].join(" "),
    link: [
      "underline-offset-4 hover:underline",
      "text-primary-600",
      "dark:text-primary-400"
    ].join(" ")
  }

  const sizes = {
    default: "h-10 px-4 py-2 text-base",
    sm: "h-9 px-3 text-sm",
    lg: "h-11 px-8 text-lg"
  }

  return cn(baseStyles, variants[props.variant], sizes[props.size], props.class)
})
</script>

<template>
  <component :is="as" :class="buttonClass">
    <slot />
  </component>

## Performance Considerations

### Optimizations Applied

1. **v-memo on Navigation Links:**
   - Prevents re-renders when navLinks array unchanged
   - Memoization key: `[navLinks.length]`

2. **GPU Acceleration:**
   - `gpu-accelerate` class on header and mobile menu
   - `transform: translateZ(0)` for hardware acceleration

3. **Image Optimization:**
   - `loading="eager"` on logo (above fold)
   - `fetchpriority="high"` for critical logo
   - Width/height attributes prevent layout shift

4. **Transition Optimization:**
   - Respects `prefers-reduced-motion`
   - Uses CSS custom properties for consistent timing
   - `backdrop-filter` disabled in reduced motion mode

5. **Focus Management:**
   - `nextTick()` ensures DOM updates before focus
   - Prevents unnecessary re-queries of focusable elements

6. **Scroll Lock:**
   - Body overflow toggled only when menu state changes
   - Cleanup in `onUnmounted` lifecycle hook

# UI Component Planning

Use the ui-analyzer subagent to create a strategic plan before building any component.

## Socialaize Planning Context

Before planning any component, check:

### Existing Foundation
1. **Base components:** `ls src/components/vue/base/`
2. **Animation presets:** `ls src/components/vue/animations/composables/`
3. **Similar patterns:** `grep -r "similar-pattern" src/components/vue/`

### Include in Plan
- Which base components to extend (if any)
- Which animation presets to use (useAnimateElement, VueUse Motion, or Tailwind utilities)
- Whether state management needed (Nanostore + BaseStore pattern)
- Whether data validation needed (Zod schema matching Appwrite attributes)
- Icon strategy (@iconify/vue with mdi or simple-icons collections)

## Process

1. **Understand Requirements**
   - Parse the component description: "Repurpose.io Hero Section: announcement banner (48px gradient purple), main heading (72px, 800 weight, 'Join 635,000+ Creators: Grow 3â€“5x Faster with Repurpose!'), subheading (32px blue #6B7FFF, 'Turn One Video into Millions of Views - Try Free Now'), primary CTA button (gradient pink, 'Automate 10 videos for FREE'), and phone mockups grid showing 4 platforms (YouTube Shorts, Instagram, TikTok, Facebook)"
   - Identify key functionality and features
   - Determine component category (button, card, modal, input, etc.)

2. **Search for Existing Patterns**
   - Search `src/components/vue/` for similar components
   - Look for reusable base components
   - Identify provider pattern opportunities
   - Check for composition possibilities

3. **Analyze Design Requirements**
   - Review `src/styles/design-system.css` for available tokens
   - Identify required colors, spacing, typography
   - Determine if new tokens are needed
   - Check for visual consistency with existing components

4. **Create Implementation Plan**
   - Decide: Reuse, Compose, or Create New
   - List required design tokens
   - Outline component structure
   - Identify accessibility requirements
   - Note performance considerations

## Output Format

Provide a concise plan in this format:

```markdown

## ðŸ” Analysis

### Similar Components Found
- **[ComponentName]** (`path/to/component.vue`) - [similarity description]
- [List all relevant existing components]

- `--skip-plan` - Skip planning/wireframing, jump straight to generation

# RepurposePhoneMockup Component Variants

Three production-ready Vue 3 phone mockup components for displaying social media platform content.

## Component Files

- `RepurposePhoneMockup.variant1.vue` - Minimal & Elegant
- `RepurposePhoneMockup.variant2.vue` - Feature-Rich
- `RepurposePhoneMockup.variant3.vue` - Accessible & Optimized

---

## Variant 1: Minimal & Elegant

**Best for:** Simple implementations, prototypes, quick mockups

### Features
- Clean phone frame with platform icon overlay
- Static placeholder content with gradient backgrounds
- Minimal props interface
- Lightweight implementation
- Profile section with username/timestamp
- Basic engagement indicators (likes, comments)

### Usage

```vue
<script setup lang="ts">
import RepurposePhoneMockup from '@/components/repurpose/RepurposePhoneMockup.variant1.vue'
</script>

<template>
  <RepurposePhoneMockup
    platform="youtube"
    username="@johndoe"
    timestamp="2 months ago"
  />
</template>
```

### Props

```typescript
interface Props {
  platform: 'youtube' | 'instagram' | 'tiktok' | 'facebook'  // Required
  username?: string   // Default: '@username'
  timestamp?: string  // Default: 'months ago'
}
```

---

## Variant 2: Feature-Rich

**Best for:** Complex applications, realistic mockups with actual content

### Features
- Video/image source support with loading states
- Platform-specific UI layouts
- Hover effects and interactions
- Profile pictures and enhanced engagement metrics
- Caption display support
- Image lazy loading with skeleton state
- Interactive hover scaling
- Real engagement numbers with formatting (1.2K, 1.5M)

### Usage

```vue
<script setup lang="ts">
import RepurposePhoneMockup from '@/components/repurpose/RepurposePhoneMockup.variant2.vue'
</script>

<template>
  <RepurposePhoneMockup
    platform="instagram"
    video-src="https://example.com/video-preview.jpg"
    username="@creator"
    timestamp="2 days ago"
    caption="Check out this amazing content!"
    :likes="15000"
    :comments="432"
    profile-image="https://example.com/avatar.jpg"
    :interactive="true"
    :dark-mode="false"
  />
</template>
```

### Props

```typescript
interface Props {
  platform: 'youtube' | 'instagram' | 'tiktok' | 'facebook'  // Required
  videoSrc?: string         // Video/image URL for preview
  username?: string         // Default: '@username'
  timestamp?: string        // Default: 'months ago'
  darkMode?: boolean        // Default: false
  interactive?: boolean     // Enable hover effects - Default: false
  caption?: string          // Video caption text
  likes?: number           // Default: 1200
  comments?: number        // Default: 89
  profileImage?: string    // Profile picture URL
}
```

### Features Explained

**Loading States:**
- Shows animated skeleton while image loads
- Smooth transition to loaded content

**Hover Effects:**
- Phone scales up 5% on hover
- Enhanced shadow depth
- Platform icon badge appears
- Play button scales

**Number Formatting:**
- 1,234 â†’ 1.2K
- 1,234,567 â†’ 1.2M

## Variant 3: Accessible & Optimized

**Best for:** Production environments, enterprise applications, accessibility-first projects

### Features

- Full keyboard navigation support (Tab, Enter, Space)
- Comprehensive ARIA labels and descriptions
- Screen reader announcements for interactions
- Semantic HTML (header, nav, time, button elements)
- High contrast mode support
- 44x44px minimum touch targets
- Focus ring indicators on all interactive elements

#### Performance Optimizations
- Lazy loading with Intersection Observer
- `v-memo` for expensive rendering optimization
- CSS containment for layout/paint isolation
- GPU acceleration with `transform: translateZ(0)`
- Responsive scaling based on viewport
- Prefers-reduced-motion detection
- Image preloading only when in viewport

#### Enhanced UX
- Live announcements for screen readers
- Long-form number formatting (1,234 likes)
- Reduced motion fallbacks
- Dark mode with high contrast text overlays
- Semantic time elements with datetime attributes

</script>

    video-src="https://example.com/tiktok-preview.jpg"

    :comments="1250"

- Responsive scaling based on viewport
- Prefers-reduced-motion detection
